mechanoreception.notes: Sea anemones are generally sensitive to touch and water currents, which they use to detect prey and avoid predators. This is inferred from other anemone species.

chemoreception.notes: Sea anemones use chemoreception to detect chemical cues in the water, helping them locate food and suitable settlement sites. This is inferred from other anemone species.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception in Sagartiidae is unknown.
